intro: Galium bungei var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, often prostrate stems that produce small, white or pale pink flowers. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its narrower foliage compared to other Galium species.
